Instructions: Steam the broccoli until tender.
In a saucepan, melt the butter and add the milk and cheese.
Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.
Pour the cheese sauce over the steamed broccoli.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Steam the broccoli until tender.
Blend the steamed broccoli, vegetable broth, sour cream, thyme, and lemon zest until smooth.
Return the mixture to a pot, reheat gently, and season with salt and pepper.
Steam the broccoli until tender.
In a pan, melt the butter and butterscotch syrup.
Add the steamed broccoli and toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Steam the broccoli until tender.
In a bowl, toss the steamed broccoli with olive oil and dried herbs.
Season with salt and pepper.
Steam the broccoli until tender and set aside.
Cook the macaroni according to package instructions, then drain.
In a saucepan, melt the butter, add the flour, and cook until it forms a paste.
Gradually whisk in the milk and cook until the sauce thickens.
Stir in the grated cheese until smooth.
Combine the cooked macaroni, steamed broccoli, and cheese sauce.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20-25 minutes or until golden and bubbly.
Bake the potatoes until tender.
Steam the broccoli until tender and set aside.
Cut open the baked potatoes, fluff the insides, and mix with sour cream, cheddar cheese, and steamed broccoli.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with chives.
